MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
It's a few days later.
I pull a confused Brittany and bring her to the watchtower she had built.

The sky is cloudy, and there's no moonlight at all.
How many times did I almost get lost on the way?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
What are we doing out here at night, Conductor?
What brings us to this hut?

Actually, I've made a lot of ciders here, too.
I show her two bottles of cider. One is made from Brittany's recipe.
The other one I asked Rennes to get the recipe of the Shana people back home, and made it according to that recipe. In fact, the only thing I need this time is this cider.
Come on, have a little drink of this one first.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: You've done so much for me...Okay, I'll taste it.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
This is...! It definitely tastes like Shana cider.
It's amazing that you were able to recreate it so perfectly, Conductor!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I knew that my cider recipe was different.
How could it be different when I had it all down pat in my head?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Am I gradually forgetting about the Shana clan?
Oh, no, that's not possible. I will always be...
Brittany is upset. I hold out the recipe I have written down to her.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: This is...
This recipe that I recreated here, Brittany, is exactly the same as the one you mentioned, as you can see. Of course, I followed the temperature range and the time to let it ferment.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: R-really...? So why does my cider taste so different?
Brittany. Now, why don't you try this cider?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: You recreated this with my recipe, Conductor. I see...
Nervously, Brittany takes a sip of her cider.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It tastes the same...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
That's great. That's amazing, Conductor.
You made a perfect cider that I couldn't.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: So, the problem is not with the recipe, but with me.

The recipe is the same, so it must be true that Brittany herself has a problem.
But it's not how she makes it that's at fault.

I show Brittany, who is distressed, a bottle I've been hiding.
In fact, it was the cider that she had made for me to drink.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Is that the cider I made? Eh, but it was a failure.
So why did it taste like the Shana clans?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: The recipe is the same. Was I making the same thing? But it was definitely different. What was different about it? The difference...

Muttering to herself, Brittany turns her face into the air and ponders.
Then she seems to notice something.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: ...The moon.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I see. That's what it was.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I put too much of my loneliness towards the moon.
I thought I was calming my mind, but instead I was spreading the pain.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
In the end, in the back of my mind, I was still lamenting as a child
that there were Shana people on the moon and that I couldn't get to them!

In the end, this was an answer that could only come from Brittany. However, I remembered that Brittany had said, "On a moonlit night." So I thought that tonight, when there was no moon, it might be possible.

A meal can taste good or bad, depending on how you feel at the time,
even if you eat the same thing. It's just like that.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Yes, the remaining Shana people in Brecheliant were all smiles when they drank this cider. Unlike me, they weren't sipping it to comfort their loneliness, they were savoring their wisdom and pride.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
The Shana clan, who live strongly, are certainly here.
Why was I always looking so far away?

Brittany takes another sip of cider and gulps it down.
Her face is somehow radiant.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Rennes
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Brittany, where are you?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Oh, Rennes came looking for me, didn't she?
She's not crying, "Where are you, sister?" like in the past.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Really, you're all so meddlesome...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Brittany
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Thank you, Conductor. The moon was always within my reach.

Brittany holds a bottle of cider up to a hanging lantern.
The bottom of the bottle is round and golden.

Then Rennes, Brittany, and I had a galette and cider party.
It was a very lively night, with laughter echoing in the dark and quiet forest.
